page.title: 03FARM VISITS.
page.content:
We visited three farms in our block, all in the western half.
{GRANGE FARM}covers 242 acres, and is mainly a dairy farm with some crops. I has over 200 British Friesian cows which yield thirty litres of milk each daily, for about 9 months of the year. The farmer grows wheat, barley and oil seed rape. The farm was built in 1872 and much expansion has taken place mainly due to the modern methods of farming. This farm was inherited by the present family. {HIGHFIELD LODGE}can be found at the junction of the Wellingborough to Sywell Road and Highfield Road. It covers 68 acres of which 20 are used for hay and 48 for grazing. this land is rotated yearly. There are some 150 sheep and over 250 lambs were born this year. {(cont.)
